text: Intense esters, yeast, wheat and other grain malts. Hazy, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light sweet. Grain and bread malts continue, wheat, yeast, esters. Nice Hefeweizen, well-balanced. Keg at brewpub, Chicago.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazed golden amber with a large white head. Big banana and yeast on the nose, loads of phenols. Medium bodied, banana and a hint of clove over wheat, spicy phenols. Long lingering banana yeast on the finish with a touch of warming alcohol peeking through.
On tap at the brewpub. Hazy orange pour with a small white head. Aroma is yeasty and banana. Taste is similar, but kinda thin. Bready finish.

On tap at Piece. Pours murky orange with an off white head. Nice head retention. Aroma is of banana, clove, wheat and lemon. Taste is nice and spicy with grass, banana and wheat. Lingering banana and lemon. Mouthfeel is medium and sticky. Body is medium and decently carbonated. Tastes good, and it goes down easy. Definitely a beer I could drink a few of.
On tap @ Beer Camp - Chicago. Pour is hazy yellow with a bubbly white head. Aroma and flavor of banana, heavy yeast, slight citrus, clove, and light spice.

Draft. One of the final pours of GTOM. Was behind the booth enjoying a convo with Vav pretty good on the american brewed hefeweizen scale, banana clove. Andy should give me a growler to try, then maybe ill let him try my dinky ass session ipa homebrew.
a nicely flalvored hefeweisen. slightly lemony and wheaty with a nice bitter finish. smells wheaty and is somewhat sweet. pours cloudy orange in color. had at piece brewery.

Cloudy pale yellow, white head. Banana, hay. Slight bitterness, into more sweetness. Light carbonation, light body, pretty chewy. Pretty nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Piece. Poured hazy yellow orange with large white head. Sweet banana wheat aroma. Light carb med bod. Slight sweet banana taste. Pretty standard hefe.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 Refrigerated growler from clownoisseur. Pours cloudy light orange with medium white head. Clove aroma, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is clove,some banana, some grainyness, and spice (with hints of black pepper).  Good hefe.

Draft sampled at the brewpub. Pours cloudy yellow with a small off white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana and citrus. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

The beer has a really nice orangish color with a decent haziness to it. The head is a nice clean white one finger head with minimal lacing on the glass. The smell has mild notes of spice and yeast with a slight bitterness to it, not very fruity as expected with a hefeweizen. The taste is decent with a good blend of banana, clove, yeast, and spice. The mouthfeel is pretty decent with a mild spiciness (sp) and some bitterness in the back end. Overall, this is really good beer and I hate to discourage people on it but not worthy on WBC Bronze.

7/27/2010: Piece Top Heavy Hefeweizen... Aroma: Caramelized wheat; hints of clove spice; suggestions of banana. Appearance: Dull orange color; cloudy; small ring off-white foam. Flavor: Nice, controlled amount of banana and clove; finished with some sweeter, toasted maltiness. Palate: Average. Overall: Respectable Hefe; good one for beginners...
Draught (5.5% ABV) at Piece in Chicago. Rating #112 for this beer.

Tap @ Piece in Chicago with TheAlum. Pours a nice, cloudy yellow appearance with a white head. Somewhat spicy, light banana, a bit yeasty, light veggie aroma. Theres some more veggie notes in the flavor along with some wheat, light citrus, and bread. I had this a couple of years back at GABF and didnt remember it having any veggie notes but this time it was hard to ignore. Would like to try again in the future.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate banana, light clove, and a touch of bubblegum. Its a cloudy dull brownish-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of banana that quickly mixes with wheat and citrus tanginess. The finish has light lemon and clove. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall...I always stop here when in Chicago specifically for this beer and I always seem to miss it. I finally get to try it and it was worth the wait. Its a must try if you like Hefeweizens.

Had on tap at Piece. Served in a 22 oz. Hefe glass.

A: Pours a very chilled and hazy dark straw that bubbles to a very light brown at the body of the glass. A fluffy, pure white head forms on the pour, about one finger in height, that stick with me down the entire glass. Splotches of lace follow me down the glass. Looks perfect.

S: Great notes of wheat, clove, peppery yeast and a subtle bubblegum.

T: The taste follows the nose, but there is a little bit more peppery yeast bite with a little less sweet bubblegum. The wheat becomes more prevalent as well with a slight malt character.

M: Medium bodied, but leaning towards the lighter side. Little coating quality that really lets the yeast resonate in your mouth.

O: Its obvious why this beer has won multiple awards. Its very delicious and I would have again and again. All the characteristics in the taste really mesh well.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-16-2011
Tap at the brewpub. Hazy rich yellow pour with a white head. Great aroma of banana, wheat, and clove. Killer hefe.

On draft at brewpub, poured a nice mixture of cloudyy orangge and cloudy yellow.  Aromas of wheat, ripe bananas, and light clove.  Flavors are the same, banana u front, light spicey clove in the back.  Solid hefe overall.

Im a bit torn.  Ive had this beer on two separate occasions and the first time I had it, it was one of the best hefeweizens Ive had and the second time it was a bit off and had a skunkiness undertone to it.  Im gonna say that the second time was an anomaly and review the first one.

Aroma was heavy on clove, banana, a bit of citrus and some orange or other citrus.  Beautiful cloudy and brilliant orangish yellow color.  Lots of thick white head and lacing.  Taste perfectly matched the aroma and had lots of flavor packed into each sip.  Gorgeous taste.  Very little bitterness with some grassiness.

Overall I loved this beer with the exception of having a bad batch the second time.  I would try again just to make sure though.  Its a great compliment to their dark wheat beer which I LOVE.
Huge banana aroma.  Not much head.  Cloudy pour.  Mouth is medium bodied.  Taste has some grain, banana and malt.  A very nicely executed Hefe.
Cloudy yellow with a white head. Strong banana, light clove aroma. The flavor is similar, crisp malt profile to boot. Really good hefe.

draft.  cloudy orange. wonderfully dry, tart, pungent and prickly yeast presence. dried fruit esters (lemon peel, dried peach, mango, banana, orange) abound.  dry, parched finish is minerally and chalky. perhaps a bit too astringent and over-hopped but otherwise very delicious with lively carbonation, firm but light texture and pleasant ester play.

[Tap] Pours a hazy dark golden color with a huge cap of white head. Lots of bubblegum, clove and banana in the aroma. Mild sweet wheat malt in the nose as well. Nice hefe yeast character in the taste. Some vanilla, citrus and heavy wheat malt blends well with the esters here. The one downside (and its slight) is that it comes off as being a bit grainy. Otherwise, the body is excellent. Creamy mouthfeel and fine carbonation levels. A very respectable hefe.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy, richer and brighter orange colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a solid lacing throughout. Aroma is pretty nice. Medium sweet, bready wheat malts with a light cove spice and solid banana. A light yeast, a hint of lemon, and a touch of bubble gum. Flavor is similar. Medium sweet banana bread and wheat up front before a touch of lemony citrus and some clove comes in. Finishes smooth and clean before drying with a light bitterness. Medium length aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid hefe. Nice banana-wheat bread and light lemon-clove that is well balanced and easy drinking. Good beer.

On tap at Piece in Chicago. This was a surprising and solid example of a standard German hefe. To me, they didnt take a lot of risks with this one, but not to their detriment. On the pour, some light and fluffy pillowy white head that coats the glass well, and a hazy golden yellow colored body. Nice fruity bananas, mellow wheat, reserved clove spice, and some other mixed fruits in the aroma. A medium-light feel, and not as thick and bready as some hefes can be. Again, conservative notes that are standard yet high on quality. Big bananas, clove spice, wheat dinner rolls, and mixed estery fruit. This was nice. I imagine this going quite well with one of their pizzas... maybe next time.

Cerveza de trigo muy poderosa.sabor contundente,turbia,no demasiada espuma sabor banana .
muy lograda!!
recomendable
Bebida en tirador en Piece (Chicago)

Tasted on 7/3/11 from a growler purchased at Piece for the $25 large pizza and growler Sunday special (one of the best values in Chicago).  Pours cloudy light orange with an average smooth white head that recedes to nothing more than a thin layer of lace.  The nose is signature hefeweizen with spicy clove, banana, a bit of cashew nuttiness, and an almost creamy aroma as well.  The flavor is crisp and dry with spicy clove up front, moving to the banana, cashew, and that same almost creamy thing.  The body is medium with average, stinging carbonation, and a long banana, slightly nutty, and spicy clove finish.

Tap.  Pours cloudy yellow with a light, fizzy white head, short retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (straw, hay, bread), banana, cloves, citrus, and coriander.  Flavor is malty with banana, coriander, and cloves.  Light body, low warmth, medium carbonation and a dry finish.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a moderate yellowish color that is quite cloudy and has a nice white head. Nose is yeast, wheat, and light citrus. The taste is wheat and citrus with a bit of a yeasty kick. Nice body with good carbonation. A bit heavy but drinks well.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-02-2010

On tap at Piece...Medium gold with a light orange tint...The aroma is nice with oranges, wheat and yeast nice and balanced. The taste is a little disappointing, too sweet with banana, needs to be more balanced. Easy to drink but nothing special.

Overall, pretty good.
Tap at piece.  Peary, crisp banana, and a light herbal grass presence.  Fruity.  Kinda like you and me.

Draught at the brewpub.   Hazy gold, white head.   Spicy banana bread aroma.   Creamy clove and banana in the flavor.   Lightly sweet but well balanced with a drying finish.   Lightly creamy body but still light and crisp.   Higher carbonation.   Well done stuff.   Light and clean feeling but with the full weizen yeast flavor.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy golden with a decent off-white head and a strong citrus and wheat aroma. There is a hearty slightly sour wheat flavor that is very yeasty. An excellent hefe.

On-tap.

A - Cloudy, medium color of gold with a slight orange tint. Pretty good sized, creamy, thick, fluffy, white head. Good retention that settles into a nice creamy layer of lace.

S - Some banana along with a good amount of malted wheat aroma. Good amount of clove and some other spice and a fair amount of vanilla present.

T - Good amount of malted wheat and bready flavors. Fair amount of banana present, although it isnt the most banana forward Hefeweizen. Faint bubblegum taste toward the finish. A touch of lemon and yeast tartness along with a slight tangy taste.

M - Medium body with a good amount of carbonation. A bit of a zesty and tingly feel.

D - Very drinkable beer with a nice refreshing feel and a fair amount of zesty taste. Overall a very refreshing beer.

Notes: A nice refreshing Hefeweizen. Not the most banana/bubblegum forward, but it is a good, refreshing beer and has a good spiciness. Very enjoyable beer, especially on a warm summer day.

Wow. This might be the best Heffe Ive ever had. Gorgeous cloudy/murky golden pour with copious amounts of beautiful foamy white head with thick and sticky lacing left all around the glass. Aroma is a pleasant mix of spices with some malty/wheaty/yeasty notes. Flavor is similar, but MUCH more intense and absolutely delicious. Amazingly complex and flavorful considering the 5.5% abv. Incredibly drinkable - I could honestly drink this stuff all day every day.  Surprisingly substantial and chewy mouthfeel. One of the best beers Ive had period. LOVE LOVE LOVE this stuff. Once you take a sip its quite clear why this beer has one so many awards, including GOLD at the 2006 World Beer Cup.

This is a truly fantastic brew - Im already looking forward to the next time I get to try some.
Murky gold pour with a decent head.  Banana bread aroma.  Banana, citrus, and bread on the tongue.  Dense mouthfeel.  Really good hefe!

Good hefe. Rich flavor with fruity notes as well as the yeasty and breadiness youd expect. A little spicy and with that spiciness comes a little sourness that I find slightly off-putting and why this beer isnt an elite hefe.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Chicago, IL). Pours a nice murky golden orange, mellow and dulled out, a decent whitish head dies to a small ring on the edges. Pretty murky. Aromas are a heavy blast of banana bread anc cloves, a touch of vanilla, a touch of lemon peel, faint vanilla. Initial is banana, citrusy lemon, wheat bread, flaked white wheat with a touch of bitterness, clove, vanilla, the bitterness is more apparent on the backend, still a nice fruity and bread element on the front. A mellow summer Hefe with good flavors, a bit too much bitterness, heavier or more bodied for the style. Quite tasty, bready, citrusy and banana battle of fruits. A little bit of buttery popcorn pops into the nose, a bit distracting. A pretty good wheat beer overall.

Growler. Pours a hazy orange grapefruit with a pillow like white head. Aroma has a strong clove note with undertones of banana and wheat. The clove is again strong in the flavor with underlying banana, floral and wheat notes. Nicely carbonated and a solid beer.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2010 Piece is an amazing brewery and pizza joint in Chicago.  Love this Hef, wheaty, a tad fruity, easy to drink.  Citrus aroma of lemon, orange zest.

Tap at Piece.  Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized creamy white head.  The aroma is cloves, bananas and grassy hops.  The flavor is more clove and banana with herbal and grassy hops.  Light-medium bodied, smooth and easy drinking.  This went down nicely after walking from GI Clybourn.  

t

On tap at Piece. Pours hazy golden orange with white head head. Aroma is heavy with banana, clove, bubblegum, sweet citrus and esters. Flavors of banana, clove, yeast, lemon, esters, and some malt. Full flavored hefe for sure. I thought it was pretty solid. Much heavier beer than the german standard.
Cloudy yellow color. Medium off white head. Aroma and flavor of wheat, yeast, and clove. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.

GABF 2009, probably best made American made Hefe Ive had. Yellow oange cloudy pour with fluffy white head. Clovey, right amount of banana, Some lemon citrusy, fuller creamy mouthfeel., need to make a trip to Chicago
Tastes like a banana milk shake, super easy to drink, creamy - I thought it would be good, but it was really good.

Draft at the brewpub.  Pours murky golden orange with a small white head.  Nice aroma of banana, citrus, wheat, clove, and apricot.  Taste doesnt pop as much as the nose would lead you to believe, but its a nice, well balanced brew with flavors of citrus, banana, yeast, wheat, clove.  Full body, smooth, very pleasant.  Short, fruity finish.  Excellent beer for this style and great session beer.

Tap at the brewpub: Murky effervescent golde with nearly no head retention. Typical hefe aroma with some tart-ish wheaty notes giving a mild lemon peel hint that meshes with some clvoe phenlics- a decent spice presence. Crisp light body with a yeasty yet balanced flavor. Some citrusy wheat character under mild banana esters and clove hints. A bit minerally toward the back. A decent hefeweizen.
Wow this beer has a huge nose, just explodes with banana pie filling, along with some clove and citrusy fruit esthers.  Slightly light on the palate and lacking in depth, this is still a tasty beer.

Sampled during Dark Lord Day 09 back in April via roving growler in line for a few bottles of Dark Lord. Pours a hazy golden pale colored brew with an average white head that has some nice retention. Aroma of heavy banana esters, yeast, some light clove, tropical fruit and some bubble gum. Taste is medium to full bodied, flavors of Hefe yeast, banana esters, bubble gum, clove and a touch of citrus zest. Finish is smooth, with a fast disappears banana and golden grain malt aftertaste. A tad more wheat than I am used to but still quite excellent.

Tap at Piece.  Pour is very cloudy deep yellow with medium tan head.  Aroma is wheat, floral notes, lots of fruit, some spiciness, and some faint hop aromas.  Smells wonderful.  Flavor is true to nose with a prominent fruit flavor that is very nice.  Its a rich full hefe and really good.

64oz growler.  mouthfeel is a 5 -- echoes the bubblegum found in the esters with a juicy, responsive and alive palate.  aroma is a killer blend of banana and even raspberry. more raspberry in the flavor.  appearance is like sludge, ultra cloudy.  mouthfeel continues to impress, so soft. this is a very drinkable and quite complex weizen, its just alot of fun!

A hazy orangey blonde with a thin white head. In aroma, a nice pungeant weizen with loads of cloves, solvent, banana cake. In mouth, a sweet weizen with cherry notes, banana esters, rather intense yet quaffable. On tap at brewpub, May 18 2009.
Tap at Piece Post DLD ... hazy yellow ... sweet banana fruit nose ... big banana hop ... little bubblegum ... bit clawing.

Tap at piece.  This was really enjoyable.  One of the best I had at piece.  Cloudy gold color wtih a white head.  Yeast, bananas, bubble gum, bread and spices lead to a really enjoyable beer.  Mouthfeel is very nice and flavor is very nice indeed.  Wheat, banana, honey and just a nice hint of hops.  Session time!

Pour is murky yellow with some dark copper highlights. Dense snowy white head. The nose is banana followed by clove. The flavor is balanced clove to banana. Medium fluffy body with prickly carbonation. Dry chalky finish.

Medium sized foamy off white head sits atop a orangey yellow hazy body. Bit of lacing. Nose and taste is banana cloves, honey and sugar as is the taste. Mouthfeel is nice and bubbly. The finish length is short to medium. This is good and a solid hefeweizen but it does nothing new...

(10/11/08) Draught at the brewpub in Chicago. Cloudy dark orange with a small white head that falls immediately. Wheat aroma with some banana, clove and light citric hints. Sweetish wheaty flavor with fruity esters, moderate spiciness, yeasty notes, some orange and lemon hints and light tartness. Medium-bodied. Refreshing.

I took a couple of sips of TheDudes while he was dying a bit. Nice look, good smell and taste. Made me wish Piece would clean out the hipsters and the dudes crushing miller lites so I could actually enjoy the place.
Crushed with Honkeybra.  Just a solid hefeweizen.  All the goodness of a quality hefeweizen, with a bit of awesomeness added in.  Would definitely like to try it again.

Had this brew at G.A.B.F. 08.  Aroma is a bold banana scent.  Color is a hazy golden yellow with good carbonation and a nice tight head.  It starts with a light body that goes down smooth.  Finish is a true Hefe flavor with coriander, clove and banana.  This is a tasty Hefeweizen.

Objectively speaking:
Spectacularly well-constructed brewpub hefeweizen.

I like:
Darker than most, aiming at Schneiders Weisse territory. Authentic wheaty aroma. Flowery, cerealic and loaded with fresh, creamy bananas. More aromatic than most. Intense, captivating carbonation is spot on. The bubblegum growing flavours in the finish are taken aback by a final wave of wheat freshness.

I dislike:
Perhaps a bit grainier than I prefer, but otherwise, this is amongst the best Ive had outside Europe.

At Piece 09.20.08. Hazy golden yellow, white head. Aroma is super yeasty, tangy, fruity, spicy, makes the mouth water. Flavor is spicy and wheaty, less tangy and more hearty than I expected from the aroma.

Draft at the brewpub. Poured a cloudy medium orange color with a white head. There was a distinct bubblegum aroma accompanied by banana and a hint of caramel. Medium bodied and delicately sweet. I tasted clove,  banana, and bubblegum with a buttery undertone. This was a good hefe and much better than the one I had the previous day at Goose Island Wrigleyville.

On tap at the brewery.Poured a cloudy orange color with a small lacing head. The nose was spot on.Full off bananas, cloves, spices, and wheat.Love this style beer and these guys did a great job!The finish was quite refreshing.

In short: A very tasty and heavy Hefeweizen.  Very good.
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Cloudy dark yellow body with a long-lasting small white head
In long:  Full, really full body with a ton of wheat and hay.  Bananas, coriander, orange peels, banana cake, ginger, bubble gum, banana muffin.  By Hefeweizen standards that thing is big, very big, to the point of being more nourishing than refreshing.  I could almost eat it with a fork.  I really liked it.  When you take something that is girly and German by nature and then you boost it, make its body big and heavy and turn it into something manly, you either end-up with Piece Pizza Hefeweizen or a new member of Germanys olympic female swimming team.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2008 Pours a dark murky orange with a white bubbly head.  Not much of an aroma, some lemon, dough, yeast.   This really is a German Hefe...nothing American about it.  Sweet banana, clove and lots of orange peel bitterness.  Touch of alcohol with a yeasty finish.  Medium body with some corse carbonation.  Nothing like fresh Hefe!

4-24-08 tap 
Thick orange cloudy beauty in the pour.  Strong hefeweizen dough lemon grassy clove smell.  Big bananas and lemon spice in the flavor.  Citris and clove are balanced perfectly here.  The flavor is not overpowering at all - rather it is balanced and thick and yummy.  I highly recommend this Hefe.

This is a delicious hef!  Porus a dark orange color and is unfiltered.  Smell is lemony and wheaty, mostly and the taste is very refreshing.  Citrusy, lemony and wheat more than the clovey spiced taste, which suited me very well.  I really thought this was great.
Wow. Huge pilsner of this. Not stingy at all with the beer. Cloudy amber gold color. Sweet aroma of bubblegum and banana bread. Very nice Hefe, however, palate was a bit light for me.
Aroma is pure bubblegum. Taste is on the sweet side with just the right amount of sulfur and carbonation. Decent stuff.
Pour is hazed golden yellow with a thin white head...smell is nice balance of banana and clove...taste is nice and wheaty with well done banana and clove...
Very esteric aroma, lots of banana and bubblegum.  Cloudy orange.  Not too tart. Good.  Light to medium body.
Pours a hazy bright gold with almost no head.  Tastes like it smells...has some lemon,  banana, and cloves in it.  Very drinkable and goes does easy.  Overall, very nice hefeweizen.

tgchbon tap at piece. pours hazy golden with creamy white head. nose of banana and cloves with subtle hop notes, all seem pretty mellow and enjoyble. flavor is much of the same. very balanced and insanely drinkable. med body. i find this hefe to be right on and exactly what i want...so i guess im the yuppie hat lives in (near) the area.

Draft at brewpub.  Decent session beer.  I just dont think it can compare to a great German hefe-- especially Schneider on draft in Germany.  Actually reminded me a little of a saison I brewed a few years ago.  Decent session beer, but nothing to write home about.  Probably a good beer for all the yuppies that live in the area.

Pours a cloudy straw yellow with virtually no head or carbonation. Tart vegetal aroma is over the top and smells of rotting plant matter. Fortunately, it tastes a lot better than it smells, with all the appropriate hefe characteristics there in spades -- lemony citrus, fresh bread, banana, and an extra dose of spicy clove. Medium body and surprisingly lively palate. A great-tasting hefe that misses that mark aesthetically.

Draft at brewpub. Poured cloudy yellow color with an average fizzy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate banana, clove and citrus aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Medium sweet flavor with a solid sweet wheat finish of moderate duration.  Good refreshing brew.

This was a solid hefe, and I have never been a wheat beer fan.  Peice does all their wheats well though, so it was no surprise this followed suit.  Very smooth but it still had some muscle, and great with the pizza.  Basically what I expect a hefe to be.

On tap at Piece Brewery, and served in a tall weizen glass.  This beer poured a hazy, bright golden amber color with a small, white head that quickly faded away,  Not much lace.  The aroma of the beer was made up of very strong notes of bubblegum, fruity banana esthers, and also a bit of clove.  Very appealing!  The flavor did not disappoint either.  The strong notes of bubblegum and banana came to the forefront, but were not cloying or overpowering.  Beautifully balanced.  The mouthfeel was crisp and medium-bodied with a decent amount of carbonation.  I really loved this beer.  In my opinion, a hefeweizen cant be done much better that this!  Excellent!!!
On tap @ the Brew pub: Pours a hazy gold with a white head. Aroma, spices, cloves, yeast and some wheat. Flavor, yeast, light fruits, wheat and some cloves. Good stuff.

GTMW 2007.  The beer pours to a murky yellow-orange body with a thick, dense, huge, creamy white head.  The aroma is light flowers, oranges, dry wheat, banana, and white pepper.  The flavor is floral with oranges, dry wheat, and bananas.  The palate is medium-light bodied with a dry lively short lasting finish.

On tap at GTMW 2007
After several barrel aged imperial stouts (in 90+ degree heat) I was ready for something lighter and more palatable.  While those were worth the cost of admission it was just too hot to continue to drink them by the halfway point.  This was a great change of pace - Piece is currently one of my favorite brewpubs.  I wouldnt be too disappointed if it were the local one at all.
Aroma / Appearance - The cloudy yellow body did not let much light escape.  As it swirled around the poor designed kolsch glass I saw a bit of white head form.  The nose is mostly banana but not intensely so.
Flavor / Palate - The taste was pretty simple and clean, just as I was hoping.  Banana and yeasty notes formed the bulk but somewhere in there was a little spiciness.  This was a very well made hefeweizen which is perfect for days like the GTMW.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy dark golden color with a huge white head filling the hefe glass. The intense sulfur aroma of the yeast was my favorite thing about the beer. It has a strong banana finish to it. Yummy.
On tap @ the brewpub. Hazy yellow in colour with a rather large white head. Typical german style hefeweizen. Too sweet for me. Banana and yeast notes.
Chicago Trip. Monday 12:24. On tap at the brewpub. Cloudy orange. Light white foam and lacing. Big banana nose with orange notes around the edge. Refreshing banana notes. Dusty yeast finish.

Draught during my Dark Lord excursion. Pours an extra cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Theres a strong, sweet banana presence and light cloves with a little bit of wood in the aroma. Nicely rich and refreshing in the way of flavor. Sweet banana, yeasty flavors and a tasty spiced note hit the palate up front, but it doesnt finish quite as juicy. The brew falls on a papery, husky flavor. Pretty nice though. I thought it was just as good as many authentic German examples and I also liked the slightly heavier palate.

On tap.Pours a cloudy straw yellow with virtually no head or carbonation. Tart vegetal aroma is over the top and smells of rotting plant matter. Fortunately, it tastes a lot better than it smells, with all the appropriate hefe characteristics there in spades -- lemony citrus, fresh bread, banana, and an extra dose of spicy clove. Medium body and surprisingly lively palate. A great-tasting hefe that misses that mark aesthetically.

Nice dark amber & cloudy pour.  Plenty of strong wheat aroma with fruity scents.  Nice malty profile with spices.  Surprisingly good beer from a place I had never heard of.  Thanks to my little sister for introducing me to Piece!

On tap at Piece.  This was an unexpectedly great beer!  Poured a deeper hazy golden with a cap of white head.  Nose was ideal for a hefe... bananas, tart wheaty notes, some pale malts, and peppery spices.  Flavor followed suit, adding a candy-like sweetness and deeper spices.. really enjoyed it.  Sweet malts were well-balanced with tart notes and spices.  Rather heavily-bodied for the style.  Really good stuff!
Hazy golden pour.  Big citrusy nose.   Flavors of cut grass, lemons, banana, bubblegum, cloves, pepper, and yeast.   Exceptionally refreshing on a warm summer day.  Well done.

on tap at piece...Im not too familiar with hefs, but this one seemed pretty decent.  Color was a hazy orange with aome white head.  Aroma was definitely citrusy and had a bit of spice.  Flavor was citrusy and peppery...a bit of yeast too.  Mouthfeel was a bit heavy...but still refreshing.

On tap at the brewpub.  Pours a cloudy, dense peachy orange with a large foamy white head.  Banana and bubblegum with green apple, green grapes and other light fruits explode in the aroma.  Taste follows with some ester notes.  A stellar hefe.

Draft... DLD06... Murky, golden ale with a large, creamy, white head. Good retention. Yeasty, citrusy nose with lots of clove and lemon peel. Some bubble gum. Citrusy, doughy, spicy flavor. Very tart and lemony. Light to medium-bodied and lightly creamy with lively carbonation. Finishes tangy, spicy and refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2006 Outstanding version of a German hefeweizen.  Poured out golden copper in color with a full head.  The aroma is fruity and quite banana-y.  Flavor is rich in banana and some bitter hops.  Quite tasty and refreshing not too full in body.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2007 a terrific Hefeweizen.  like a carbonated orange/banana smoothie.  wonderful.... after having several more hefes, and the top heavy a couple more times, im retroactively boosting this way up.  rerate: each time i have this, i like it even more.

Draft at Piece, 4/30/2005.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a large, somewhat rocky white head.  Estery aroma of banana and clove.  Flavor has a ton of banana along with clove, bubblegum, wheat, and a yeastiness.  Quite substantial body.  An outstanding Hefe.
Oooo, banana.  Like, overripe, squishy, mashed into my glass, really really banana-ey banana.  Oh, and some wheat.  And stuff.  And banana.  Oooga oooga ooooga *monkey noises here*

Served as "top heavy" in a 22oz wheat glass.  Aroma of bubble gum and cloves, very nice with some earthy notes mixed in there.  Cloudy goldenrod with a white head that fills the top of the glass.  Great banana and/or bubble-gum flavors with a god amount of earthy clove-like spice notes.  Some grass in the lingering aftertaste.  Super creamy mouthfeal.  Hit the spot after hours of driving and "L" riding.

Pours a cloudy golden with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is nice and yeasty with good hints of citrus and clove and sweet malted wheat.  Body starts full and lightly sweet turning more dry and peppery toward the crisp finish.  Could use a touch more sweetness, but otherwise well done to style.

Unceremonial #500 (by default.)  Beautiful hazy orangish/yellow with a creamy white head.  Aroma reveals strong fruity esters including sour lemons and warm bananas, smoothed out with vanilla and cloves.  Flavor unfolds from the aroma, drawing out tart traits and a well-balanced sweetness.  Effervescent.  Creamy, like an orange smoothie paired with fresh squeezed lemons; however, the spotlight is on a standard cast of bready characteristics, similar to sourdough bread, along with a well-executed spiciness of cloves and pepper.  Enjoyable and well done.

Hazy, slightly dark golden body with a thick, fluffy white head.  Super banana and clove nose.  Some bubblegum and a touch of wheat bread.  Thick, fairly chewy body.  Tastier and more enjoyable than the Baron Von Average.  Sweet, spicy and a touch tart at the end.  Some sweet citrus comes in as well.  The finish is not too long, but its enjoyable and well crafted.  One of the tastier Hefeweizens Ive ever had.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2008 Had this as "Top Heavy" and its probably one of the best hefeweizens Ive ever had ... cloudy yellow with a solid head.  Classic banana nose.  Somehow this perfectly sweet, like mellow banana juice, but without the sometimes cardboardy starch you get in weizens.  Brilliant.

Growler fresh from the brewery: Hazy yellowish hue with an initial large frothy head which settles and produced a good lace. The aroma has a Weihenstephen character with lots of banana, pear, clove, pepper, floral, and dusty esters. The taste starts with a nice fruity component upfront supported directly by a heavy yeast character. The finish has some beautifully placed spice notes and even a touch of noble bitters as well. The feel is lively and refreshing as a hefe should be. As good and true weizen has can be found in America along with New Glarus. Piece knows how to wheat biers, get ya some, yummy!

First pour out of a freshly tapped keg at the brewpub. Pours hazy golden with a solid head that stays. Aroma is strong hefe yeast (barnyard, hay, slight bubblegum). Flavor is chewy strong hefe yeast. Yeasty goodness in a glass.

This was a fairly decent beer, but with nothing really outstanding.  Easy to drink, good with their pizza.  Didnt like the lemon stuck in the glass, though.  More banana flavors, and those type of small candies that are fruit shaped that you find in those 25 cent vending machines.

I must confess Im not a big fan of the hefeweizen style but I did like this one. Rather than reeking of banana this one had a subtle clove character that I found quite appealing. Thouroughly thick and luxuirous, its definitely a beer that could just as easily warm you in the winter as it can refresh you in the summer.

Draft: Opaque light apricot. Dense, entirely lasting, consistent layer of white foam. Textbook aroma of sherbet, banana, phenols, and clove. Vibrant hoppiness and lightly toasted malt hulls beneath the surface. Brisk crackle to the carbonation. Beautifully conditioned.  Balanced display of clove, bubblegum, and mint. Freshly mashed bananas and doughy malt flavors thicken the body. Flavorsome segue of lightly chalky yeast elements backed with fresh mint, lemon pulp, and a firm spicy phenolic snap. Fairly gritty pear texture. Bright, explosively juicy hop backbone is shadowed by subtle notes of honeydew melon and pureed bananas. Perfectly tart with a quenching apple acidity that gives way to a tongue-numbing crushed clove smattering. Lingering notes of mashed bananas, lightly toasted malts, and juicy noble hops. Definitive session brew, regardless of its vast  complexity. Befits the style to a "t."
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: On tap at the brewpub.  It is served in a bigncurvy glass.  Hazy yellow with a frothy white head.  Traditional spicey banana clove nose.  Lots of pepper, clove, banana and some orange juice as it warmed.  Excellent American version of this German style.

Curvy 22oz, glass. Cloudy orange/yellow Sulfery, bubblegum and banana nose.  Dry and peppery at first sip. Huge hefe. A Monster!!  Thick, rich and tasty!Earlier Rating: 4/6/2003 Total Score: 4.5Move over Oberon, here is my new favorite American Wheat!!!   Piece Pizza is a peculiar spot in the mixed up Wicker Park neighborhood of Chicago.  The cast of MTVs Real World worked here, the decor is mostly Cheap Trick photos and guitars, and the pizza isn't Chicago- style, but East Coast old school thin crust with a wide variety of toppings and sauces.  Back to the beer,  this bright yellow/gold and cloudy Hefe is a beauty to behold (and served in a great weisse glass that needs to be printed with their quirky logo!).  The nose is fruity, mostly banana, clovey, wheaty, cereal like, fresh, inviting.  The beer is thick, but not overly so.  The body is stout enough for big beer lovers like me, but can easily  be sessioned on a hot Summer day.  Huge fruity esters, massive banana floats, clove dust, and vanilla are all wonderful.. 
I can't wait to get back and enjoy another one!!!!!!
Pours hazy yellow.  Nose is big of banana, cloves and yeasty esters.  Typical of standard hefe.  Flavor much of the same. Very drinkable.  Great example of the style.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2007 Also as the Big n Curvey, though I wonder if it is the same thing based on other reviews. At any rate, this had nice bold orange/brown color. Smelled of yeast, bubble gum, cloves, bananas, citrus? I was pleasantly surprised by this beer, as I did enjoy it. Still, not a converted wheat drinker, but I found the taste pleasant. Breads, cloves, bananas, fruits. It was all there. A nice, smooth experience.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2004 also draft "big n curvey" at piece.  beautiful hazy orange color.  classic banana and clove taste.  easy drinking thick and silky mouthfeel.  i am starting to really like this pizzera/brewery.  great pizza too.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2004 Draught: (BignCurvy version): Fleshy mango with a thin, white head.  Orange-clove aromatics with a light alcohol effervescence.  Orange flesh and bitter lemon rinds.  Honey-butter cream plate with a light bitterness.  Spicy black pepper dust and a bit chalky.  One of the better Hefeweizens I have had in Chicago. . .

MASSIVE aroma.  Way heavy on the citrus/yeast angle of things!  Excellent hefe/wit flavor.  Halfway to a wit, due to its light color and thin body, but lots and lots of funk really deliver on the promise of an authentic European Hefe!  Fantastic.
A very good match to the style. Bananas win out over some clove esters. A good level of sweetness combines pleasantly with some tart notes from the wheat.
Beer-judging sized sampler. Appropriately cloudy, even a little white like a Belgian. Has an extreme banana and lemon nose that overwhelms the other hefeweizen spices.
tap at brewery-7/6/03-this brew appears and tastes more like a belgian whit than a german wheat.  aroma of clove and bananas-palate is subtle with hints of clove.
Cloudy, tan colour w/ fluffy white head.  Banana aroma.  Palate has more banana, hint of vanilla.  Quite sweet and very straightforward.
RateBeer Summer 2003:  Cloudy yellow with a foamy white head.  Banana  aroma, thin bodied.  A fairly good German Wheat beer.
(growler at RBSG2003):  Cloudy straw with medium white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, banana, wheat.  Taste is wheat, medium banana, nothing special.  Light body.
Huge thick white head. Full of bannana aromas, some grass. Yeasty, a bit sweet wheat .Soft, creamy and very refreshing. Slightly dry at end.

Growler at FFF, RBSG2003. JoeM says his buddy called the finish of this beer sulphury, like fireworks, and I agree. Take that firecracker wick and put your tongue on it. This Hefe has fantastic fruity and banana aroma (the second best banana aroma ever for me, coming in under Denison's?). Very little clove; huge body. Delicious.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Strong alcohol content for a hefeweizen, but with a mild flavor.  Tasty.
